channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple integration has this tiny AI podcast stock soaring
item.description: *sponsored by Good day, 360! Here are a few of the biggest movers today. And don’t forget to join us in Market Masters – And… Jeff’s Bullseye goes out...

item.title: Company blames ‘forced sale’ for wipeout that saw 98% share-price dive

item.title: Japanese company vows U.S. Steel would be American-run as election-year takeover faces mounting opposition
item.description: The pledge by Nippon Steel, Japan’s largest steelmaker, comes after Vice President Kamala Harris said the U.S. company “should remain American-owned.”

item.title: Volkswagen flags lower sales as labor unions protest potential plant closures

item.title: In an increasingly manic market, this slow-and-steady fund has broken out
item.description: A fund focusing on low volatility stocks actually recorded a record high.

item.title: Nvidia down 2% in premarket trading after plunge that wiped out nearly $300 billion in market cap
item.description: Nvidia's huge rise in recent years has been directly related to its dominance in AI chips for data centers.

item.title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba resigns amid the country's largest wartime cabinet shake-up
item.description: Dmytro Kuleba has represented Ukraine's foreign interests throughout Kyiv's battle against the invasion of neighboring Russia.

item.title: Gearing up for another great-looking trading week
item.description: Hey Folks! Jeff Bishop here and I hope you were able to join me for live trading last week in the Market Master’s Room. Guess what? I’ll be back at it...

item.title: I give my mother’s ailing next-door neighbor $500 a month. She agreed to sell me her house, although she’ll continue to live there. Is this a good plan?
item.description: “She has a next-door neighbor who is 72 and disabled, and has even more serious problems.”

item.title: Nvidia plunges almost 10%, dragging basket of chip stocks to worst day since March 2020
item.description: Nvidia's steep drop Tuesday knocked almost $300 billion in market cap off the chipmaker and weighed on the broader market.

item.title: Japanese company vows U.S. Steel would be American-run as election-year takeover faces mounting opposition
item.description: The pledge by Nippon Steel, Japan’s largest steelmaker, comes after Vice President Kamala Harris said the U.S. company “should remain American-owned.”

item.title: ‘We live on Social Security’: We lost $2,000 in an IRA after 5 years — so we fired our adviser. We put the money in CDs. Now what?
item.description: “They put all our money in mutual funds and the only person making money was our broker.”

item.title: Elon Musk's Starlink says it will block X in Brazil to keep satellite internet active
item.description: SpaceX satellite internet service Starlink said it will comply with court orders to block social network X in Brazil.

item.title: Alibaba to allow payment through Tencent's WeChat Pay for the first time on e-commerce apps
item.description: Alibaba's shopping platforms Taobao and Tmall will accept Tencent's WeChat Pay likely within this month, a source familiar with the matter told CNBC.

item.title: Before the Fed lowers interest rates, make these 4 money moves to prepare your finances
item.description: With Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell saying “the time has come” for rate cuts, here’s how to handle credit-card debt, cash and big purchases.

item.title: House Democrats ask Trump for proof he did not take $10 million 'cash bribe' from Egypt
item.description: Reps. Jamie Raskin and Robert Garcia told Donald Trump they were looking into allegations that he took a "cash bribe" from Egypt's president.

item.title: After Putin dodges arrest in Mongolia, the Kremlin says no one can hold Russia back
